block.p: WEDNESDAY -- Wave Hill, in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, will hold its annual Gardeners' Fair and Picnic to raise money for upkeep of its gardens and public programs. The event begins at 6 p.m. with cocktails; dinner follows at 7:30. The evening will also include silent and live auctions of plants, garden furniture and other prize. Tickets, $125, or $75 for those under 35, from (718) 549-3200, ext. 233.

WEDNESDAY -- Wave Hill, in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, will hold its annual Gardeners' Fair and Picnic to raise money for upkeep of its gardens and public programs. The event begins at 6 p.m. with cocktails; dinner follows at 7:30. The evening will also include silent and live auctions of plants, garden furniture and other prize. Tickets, $125, or $75 for those under 35, from (718) 549-3200, ext. 233.

Animal Aid WEDNESDAY -- The Animal Medical Center, a veterinary hospital in Manhattan, will raise money at the Waldorf-Astoria for programs that include outreach services and free or subsidized animal care for elderly and indigent pet owners. A cocktail reception at 7 p.m. will be followed by a black-tie dinner and dancing at 8. Tickets, $600, or $250 for those under 35, from (212) 685-1095.

The Philharmonic Opens WEDNESDAY -- The opening night concert of the New York Philharmonic, at Avery Fisher Hall, a black-tie event, will present the soprano Dame Kiri Te Kanawa performing works by Mozart and others. The evening will celebrate the opening of the orchestra's 159th season and will raise money for its fund supporting retiring and former musicians. A cocktail reception at 6:30 p.m. will be followed by the concert at 8, with supper at 10 in a tent on the Fordham University campus across 62nd Street from Lincoln Center. Tickets, $1,000, from (212) 875-5757, or $45 and up for the concert alone, from (212) 721-6500.

Tools for Living WEDNESDAY -- An auction at Tavern on the Green for Partnership for the Homeless, a social service and advocacy organization in New York, will raise money to help clients furnish new homes. Drinks and a buffet dinner at 6 p.m. will be followed by the auction at 7. Tickets, $100, from (212) 645-3444, ext. 121, or $125 at the door.

Child Care THURSDAY -- Montefiore Medical Center's new Children's Hospital, which is scheduled to open in the fall of 2001, will benefit from a black-tie dinner and dance at the Waldorf-Astoria. James Naughton will perform. Cocktails and a silent auction at 6:30 will be followed by dinner and dancing at 7:30. Tickets, $750, from (212) 245-6570.

Cancer Care Party FRIDAY -- The Junior Committee of Cancer Care will raise money for services to people with cancer, their families and care givers with a party at the Altman Building, 135 West 18th Street (Avenue of the Americas). The doors open at 8 p.m., when a buffet dinner will be served, with dancing to the music of a D.J. Tickets, $60, from (212) 712-8330, or $70 at the door.

Eradicating Hunger SATURDAY -- The Hunger Project will raise money to encourage leadership among women in Bangladesh and India with a photography exhibition and dinner at the New York Hilton. The evening's program will include South Asian speakers, entertainers and a video depicting the role of women in eradicating hunger. A cocktail reception and the exhibition at 6 will be followed by dinner and the program at 7:30. Black tie or national dress. Tickets, $500, from (212) 251-9100.

Freedom Honors SEPT. 25 -- Harrison Ford and Danny Glover will be among those honored by Amnesty International at its annual Media Spotlight Awards dinner, at Pier 60 at Chelsea Piers. Gabriel Byrne and Natasha Richardson will be the hosts of the evening, which will raise money for human rights. Cocktails at 6:30 will be followed by dinner at 7:30. Tickets, $250, from (212) 573-6933.

Rose Garden Dance SEPT. 26 -- The annual dinner and dance in the Peggy Rockefeller Rose Garden at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx will raise money to maintain and build the garden's collection. A cocktail reception at 6 will be followed by dinner at 7:15 and dancing to the music of the Alex Donner Orchestra. Tickets, $500, from (718) 817-8774.
